metadata.title: RHSA-2018:1328: CloudForms 4.6.2 bug fix and enhancement update (Important)
metadata.description:
Red Hat CloudForms Management Engine delivers the insight, control, and automation needed to address the challenges of managing virtual environments. CloudForms Management Engine is built on Ruby on Rails, a model-view-controller (MVC) framework for web application development. Action Pack implements the controller and the view components.

Security Fix(es):

* python-paramiko: Authentication bypass in transport.py (CVE-2018-7750)

* ansible-tower: Privilege escalation flaw allows for organization admins to obtain system privileges (CVE-2018-1101)

Red Hat would like to thank Graham Mainwaring of Red Hat for reporting CVE-2018-1101.

* ansible-tower: Remote code execution by users with access to define variables in job templates (CVE-2018-1104)

Red Hat would like to thank Simon Vikstr√∂m for reporting CVE-2018-1104.

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

This update also fixes several bugs and adds various enhancements. Documentation for these changes is available from the Release Notes document linked to in the References section.

bugzilla.text: CVE-2018-7750 python-paramiko: Authentication bypass in transport.py
CVE-2018-1101 ansible-tower: Privilege escalation flaw allows for organization admins to obtain system privileges
CVE-2018-1104 ansible-tower: Remote code execution by users with access to define variables in job templates
